Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2010 11:14PM jhbwoods wrote: Hello everyone, I just had surgery about a week ago for a radial scar  Strange thing is that I was NOT diagnosed with a radial scar.  They didn't see it!  I found a lump almost two years ago and went to my OB doc who ordered an ultrasound and mentioned sending me for a surgical consult.  I went in for an ultrasound and mammogram and was told I had a "cluster of cysts."  I'm a Radiology Transcriptionist and am familiar with these reports so the radiologist had me come in his office so he could show me what he was seeing.  He reassured me they were benign.  I told him I might have it biopsied and he said there was no need to because it was totally benign.  So I didn't go in for the surgical consult figuring this would go away on its own.  Well it didn't, it got bigger and started hurting so I went back November last year for more mammos and again the Rad said they were just benign cysts.  I went ahead and went to see the surgeon anyways.  As soon as she felt the lump she didn't like it.  She took it out last week and low and behold it was huge!  To the point that she had to do some reconstruction so I didn't have a dent in my chest.  Apparently the cysts were covering up the radial scar so thats why they didn't see it on the mammo's.  It was benign though.   All the studies I've found online recommend removal of radial scars if found on a mammogram.  Again like everyone else I've found conflicting studies on these.  According to my surgeon the studies are controversial.  When asked about increase risk of breast cancer she stated it was very slight/tiny increase of risk of breast cancer.  I got a copy of the pathology report today, I also had intraductal papillomas, fibrocystic changes and some other stuff.  I think we need to be diligent in our follow-ups, mammos, breast exams, etc.  Early detection is key! Thank goodness I went to see this surgeon.  She told me she's learned to not simply rely on the x-rays, bloodwork, etc.  She also relies on what she feels and sees and if something just doesn't feel right than its better to be absolutely sure about it than not do anything at all.  Hope this helps!
